intro: Psychotria costanensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria costanensis is also known for its role in the ecological interactions of its habitat, particularly as a host plant for certain species of insects.
